PRIVILEGE.Definition: an advantage that a person has because of their position

AMBITION.Definition: a strong wish to achieve something

POPULISTS.Definition: politicians who try to show that they represent the ideas and opinions of ordinary people

UPBRINGINGS.Definition: they way they had been brought up or raised

FAIR.Definition: just or appropriate in the circumstances

PHENOMENON.Definition: something interesting that exists and can be noticed

LAZY.Definition: unwilling to study, showing lack of effort

LAISSEZ-FAIRE.Definition: characterised by the the idea that he should be free to choose how to do things, without too much control from someone in authority

LAZINESS.Definition: the quality of being unwilling to work or use energy

GROWTH-PROFIT MATRIX.Definition: a type of graph used in business projections

CONSCIOUS.Definition: aware of or having knowledge of the situation

CAMPAIGNED.Definition: supported and organised activities towards that goal

INTEGRITY.Definition: the quality of being honest and true to his beliefs

GOSSIP.Definition: reports that are not serious or proved true, rumors

COLUMNIST.Definition: someone who wrote regular articles or columns

EXPENSES.Definition: things on which he had to spend money

SATIRICAL.Definition: that judges and comments on people or ideas in a humorous way

CLOWN.Definition: a person who acts in a comic manner, someone not to take seriously

APPROACHABLE.Definition: friendly and easy to talk to

SYMBOLIC.Definition: significant only because of what they represented

PATIENCE.Definition: the ability to wait without showing annoyance

CATAPULTED.Definition: sent or brought him very quickly

FAME.Definition: the state of being well known

GAMBLER.Definition: someone taking risks to get advantages

CHANCER.Definition: someone taking risks to get advantages

REBEL.Definition: the one that was against the decisions of the authority

ANCESTRAL HOME.Definition: the house where his family lived in the past

DOWNFALL.Definition: cause of a loss of power

BETRAYED.Definition: harmed by someone whom he trusted

CANDIDACY.Definition: position as someone who was trying to be elected

ILLEGITIMATE.Definition: born of parents not lawfully married to each other

SAGA.Definition: a long story involving a series of events

IN LOCKDOWN.Definition: in an emergency situation in which people are not allowed to freely move out of their houses

FUNERAL.Definition: ceremony or service for burying his body

RESIGN.Definition: give up or leave his office

SCANDAL.Definition: an event that causes a public feeling of shock and anger

BLOW OVER.Definition: become less important or draw less attention

NOTORIOUSLY.Definition: in a way that it is well known for something bad

CHEEKY.Definition: showing no respect in an amusing way

ONLY A MATTER OF TIME.Definition: certain to happen at some time in the future

UNFORGIVABLE.Definition: unable to be forgiven or excused

AT ALL.Definition: in any way, to any extent

REVELATIONS.Definition: the acts of making something secret known

ALLOWED OUT.Definition: permitted to get out, let out

SHED A LITTLE LIGHT ON.Definition: give some information about, make the facts about him a bit more clear
